channel.title: The Breakthrough
channel.description: Latest Articles and Investigations from ProPublica, an independent, non-profit newsroom that produces investigative journalism in the public interest.

item.title: The Breakthrough: Hopelessness and Exploitation Inside Homes for Mentally Ill
item.itunes:author: ProPublica
item.itunes:summary: A reporter finds that homes meant to replace New York’s troubled psychiatric hospitals might be just as bad.
item.description: A reporter finds that homes meant to replace New York’s troubled psychiatric hospitals might be just as bad.

item.itunes:keywords: journalism, news, investigative journalism, interview, propublica, media, behind the scenes

item.title: The Breakthrough: Behind the Scenes of Hillary Clinton’s Failed Bid for President
item.itunes:author: ProPublica
item.itunes:summary: Jonathan Allen and Amie Parnes didn’t know their book would be called ‘Shattered,’ or that their extraordinary access would let them chronicle the mounting signs of a doomed campaign.
item.description: Jonathan Allen and Amie Parnes didn’t know their book would be called ‘Shattered,’ or that their extraordinary access would let them chronicle the mounting signs of a doomed campaign.

item.itunes:keywords: journalism, news, investigative journalism, interview, propublica, media, behind the scenes
item.itunes:subtitle: Jonathan Allen and Amie Parnes didn’t know their book would be called ‘Shattered,’ or that their extraordinary access would let them chronicle the mounting signs of a doomed campaign.

item.title: The Breakthrough: How a Small News Outlet Brought Down the State Hero
item.itunes:author: ProPublica
item.itunes:summary: VTDigger’s Anne Galloway was suspicious the moment she heard about a too-good-to-be-true development. She didn’t know how right she was.
item.description: VTDigger’s Anne Galloway was suspicious the moment she heard about a too-good-to-be-true development. She didn’t know how right she was.

item.title: The Breakthrough: Reporting on Life and Death in the Delivery Room
item.itunes:author: ProPublica
item.itunes:summary: ProPublica reporter Nina Martin and her team used social media and old-fashioned shoe leather to show how the U.S. has the worst maternal death rate in the developed world.
item.description: ProPublica reporter Nina Martin and her team used social media and old-fashioned shoe leather to show how the U.S. has the worst maternal death rate in the developed world.

item.title: The Breakthrough: How an ICIJ Reporter Dug Up the World Bank’s Best Kept Secret
item.itunes:author: ProPublica
item.itunes:summary: Sasha Chavkin chased it down across three continents, and into places he was warned weren't safe.

item.title: The Breakthrough: A Reporter Crosses Borders to Uncover Labor Abuse
item.itunes:author: ProPublica
item.itunes:summary: ProPublica’s Michael Grabell travels from the heart of Ohio to the mountains of Guatemala to track down immigrant workers harmed in American poultry plants.

item.title: The Breakthrough: Uncovering NYC Cops Making Millions in Suspicious Deals
item.itunes:author: ProPublica
item.itunes:summary: On our first episode of this season’s The Breakthrough, we talk with WNYC’s Robert Lewis tells us how his reporting triggered an internal investigation of suspicious dealings made by active-duty New York police officers.

item.title: Our Podcast, The Breakthrough, Is Back
item.itunes:author: ProPublica
item.itunes:summary: In January, we launched The Breakthrough, which tells the stories behind investigative reporting. And we’re about to start a new season, on June 16.
